item.title: Create Reddit upvoter using Python and PRAW
Host a Flask app using Apache and mod_wsgi
item.description: Now that dust has settled after Youtube Thumbnail Downloader tutorial, it’s time for a new thing. When you run a Flask developement server, it tells you that it isn’t suited for prodution: WARNING: This is a developlment server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Fair point. It hasn’t been tested for security and whatnot. There are a few alternatives, most notably Nginx and Apache. I go for the latter.

item.title: Create your own Youtube Thumbnail Downloader in Python
item.description: The idea is pretty simple. Given the URL to a Youtube video, the script spews out it’s thumbnail. See this lovely image? It would make for a perfect wallpaper and I wrote a script that does just that. How would Python render it possible, you’d ask? By working hand-in-hand with Youtube API, of course! I should seriously reconsider becoming a clown. I have a hunch that it would come as natural to me.

item.title: Bugs and features
item.description: I enjoy improving applications. I do my best to report issues and propose improvements as soon as I notice them. Sometimes I find it difficult because there might be no bug tracker or it may be so obscure that I can’t help but flee. Because my reports are scattered all over various places, I decided to collect them in here.

item.title: Reviews
item.description: Video games are cool, aren’t they? Once I was under an impression that I’m able to finish every single item on my backlog. Suprisingly I’m not. But it was great quest nonetheless! I signed for reviewing every title that I will manage to finish. I was mostly publishing my reviews on Steam, thanks to it’s built-in feature. For games that I didn’t own on that platform, I published them on Metacritic.

item.title: IS THIS THING RECORD O hi there!
item.description: Hello world! I’m Bartosz. Now that I have your attention, why don’t you follow this inconspicuous and harmless link and click OK in every window that appear on your screen? Much obliged. This is it! My much awaited blog. Admit it, you was looking forward to check out what nonsensical thoughts I managed to came up with. Wait until you see my prime time commercials. I think (I hope) that it’s safe to say that I’m going to dedicate this place to some programming-related stuff.
